main event: One light larger than known star was observed in Rome, New York, changing color from orange-white to orange with red light.
interesting points: The object was seen at an azimuth of 330 degrees and at an elevation of about 4000 feet,The sighting lasted for twenty-three minutes and was viewed through binoculars,Two aircraft also reported seeing the object at the same time,Analysts concluded the object was likely the planet Venus,Conditions at the time caused the object to appear larger and brighter than usual.
sighted object: a round light larger than a known star
witness description: Air Traffic Control personnel, including a shift supervisor
